title: Kevin Durant, Rockets pummel exhausted Celtics to snap three-game winning streak: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Rockets defeated the Boston Celtics 128-101, snapping Boston's three-game winning streak on Saturday night.
Kevin Durant scored 26 points for the Rockets, who made 65.5% of their 3-pointers and dominated the game.
Celtics faced fatigue, playing their third game in four days, contributing to their struggle against the Rockets.

title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots elevate D'Ernest Johnson to 53-man roster following Rhamondre Stevenson's injury ahead of game against Falcons.
D'Ernest Johnson, a seven-year NFL veteran, has previously played for Browns, Jaguars, and Cardinals.
Running back depth challenged with Rhamondre Stevenson and Antonio Gibson out; TreVeyon Henderson to lead backfield.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov form a new defensive pairing, aiding Bruins' defensive resurgence.
In the last three games, the Bruins' defense tightened, yielding only one 5-on-5 goal with McAvoy and Zadorov.
Zadorov's physical play allows McAvoy to focus on offense, contributing to a 2-1 win over Carolina Hurricanes.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed one goal in his return, leading to a 2-1 win over the Carolina Hurricanes.
Coach Marco Sturm chose Swayman despite Joonas Korpisalo's strong performances, citing competitive advantage with two skilled goalies.
Swayman downplayed rotation change motivation, focusing on improving performance and maintaining team success.

title: 9 things to know about Red Sox’ situation entering MLB offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox enter offseason with $218.92 million in committed salary, close to the luxury tax threshold of $245 million.
Key Red Sox players Dustin May, Rob Refsnyder, and Alex Bregman may become free agents this offseason.
Potential Red Sox targets include top free agents like Kyle Tucker and pitchers Dylan Cease and Framber Valdez.

title: CBS’s Jason McCourty has seen a lot of the Patriots this season, and even he didn’t see this level of success coming
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jason McCourty to call his third Patriots game this season for CBS, previously covered games against Dolphins and Titans.
Patriots' quarterback Drake Maye is noted for his impressive progress, contributing to the team's unexpected 6-2 record.
McCourty expresses surprise at Patriots' quick improvement, attributing success to Maye's development and improved team talent.

title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are reportedly targeting Dolphins' edge rusher Jaelan Phillips before the NFL trade deadline.
The Dolphins may seek at least a third-round pick for Phillips, who ranks 11th in pressures among edge rushers.
Bradley Chubb is another potential trade candidate from Miami; both players have been productive this season.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins defenseman Mason Lohrei has been scratched for the third consecutive game against the Hurricanes.
Coach Marco Sturm advises Lohrei to view his lineup exclusion as a learning opportunity and stay prepared.
Adjustments in lineup include McAvoy pairing with Zadorov, boosting defensive stability over Lohrei's previous role.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Falcons enter Sunday's game with a 3-4 record, seeking playoff momentum against a streaking Patriots team.
Bijan Robinson leads the NFL in scrimmage yards per game, posing a dual-threat challenge for New England.
Falcons' defense ranks second in yards allowed and features strong performances from cornerback A.J. Terrell and rookie safety Xavier Watts.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts' two-run single in the third inning led the Dodgers to a 3-1 victory over the Blue Jays.
Kiké Hernandez's defensive play in the ninth inning secured the Dodgers' win, throwing out Addison Barger at second base.
The Dodgers' victory over Blue Jays in Game 6 forces a decisive Game 7 in the World Series.
